mechanoreception.notes: Sponges lack a nervous system, but cells are capable of responding to physical stimuli. Mechanoreceptors likely allow the sponge to sense water flow and physical contact.

chemoreception.notes: Sponges are filter feeders and must be able to detect chemical cues in the water to regulate feeding and other physiological processes.

photoreception.notes: The presence of photoreceptors in Darwinellidae is currently unknown. It cannot be ruled out, but no data exists to support their presence.
